data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You would not return to the starting line for steps left: 9 steps. The beginning line is always facing forward. The first step taken is forward. Steps 1 and 2 were taken backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around means going back toward the starting point. There are 4 steps and 4 steps. The starting point is the location where you started. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 6 steps and turn around, you get 6 steps back. Similarly, if you take 4 steps and turn around, you get 4 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and take 7 seconds to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The sequence is in reverse order. First turn 10 steps and then take 9 steps and take 3 steps and 2 steps and 3 steps and take 3 steps. Finally turn around, take 5 steps and the sequence is in reverse order. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right you'll always turn around. So the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one takes the opposite direction then one begins taking 8 steps. The answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you do the initial step one over again, you repeat the sequence in reverse. If you complete the previous steps one over again, you repeat the sequence in reverse. If you complete the previous steps twice, you repeat the sequence in reverse. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing backwards, you can go 1 step left then move forward to face forward. Since the previous step was taken right, this move was forward to take the previous step. If you are facing forward, and move 1 step left, you are going to take 1 step right, and move 4 steps forward. Since the previous step was made right, this move was forward to take the previous step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 steps back to starting point and turn around. Take 2 steps back to starting point and turn around. Take 7 steps back to starting point and turn around. Take 3 steps back to starting point and turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
First, there are two steps forward from the starting position. Second, there are two steps backward from the starting position. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always begin a new direction at the horizon. For this scenario, you would always take 6 steps forward. That means, you always face forward. The only way to go backwards is to take 6 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You should take 9 steps left first. If you start facing forward, this means the person is facing forward. If you start facing backwards, this means the person is facing backwards as well as forward. If you are facing forward, this means you are facing opposite ways from the starting point. There is a set of directions that you could follow as you move forward, and if you repeat any of them, you will never return to the starting point which is always backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s say you are facing forward and have 4 steps to your left and 3 steps to your right. On your right side you will take 3 right steps and on your left side you will take 4 right steps. On your right side you will take 1 forward step and on your left side you will take 6 left steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Your steps backwards should never come after facing forward. Your steps forward should only come after facing forward. People always take 5 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn right twice and turn right. Take 4 steps. If you are turning around, turn left. Take 4 steps, take 10 steps. If you are turning around, take 10 steps. The process is the same the three times. So, the answer is Yes.

You cannot take 6 steps and 8 steps back at the same time. So, the answer is no.

The first step turns left and we are going up a hill. The second step turns around and we are going south. Thus, the answer is No.

If you turn around, you cannot go back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The number of steps is 5. Turn right to take 1 step. The number of steps is 5. The answer: Yes.

This is the same path as the previous instructions: Take 1 step, Take 3 steps, turn right, take 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turning around means you are going to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn back gives you 5 minutes to get to your starting point. Turning around takes 5 minutes to get to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, after 5 steps backward you just get 5 steps forward. If you look forward 8 steps left, then you take 7 steps forward. If you look at each step you take 7, 7, and 7, then you would take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The original instructions are for left handed people who are facing right. The correct way to make a turn is always to face forward with one foot first then take 7 steps backward while the right way is to face left with one foot first then take 9 steps left. The starting position is from above. So, the answer is No.

The fourth step has to be taken to make the third step back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

This is a simple direction change in a regular person’s walk. So, the answer is Yes.

You can turn around in 5 steps. If you have 5 steps left, turn around. So, the answer is No.

The first 2 to 3 steps you take backward is 2 steps behind. And the 8th step is to face forward. So, the answer is No.

A step is one step from a starting one and can be replaced with one. An instruction to take a step is a verb phrase and a verb will always mean the same thing. So, the answer is No.

Whenever someone tells you to face the forward direction, always face forward when given the instruction. As you look forward, you would return to the starting point. If you see that you are looking left, you should point right. If you see that you are facing right, you should point left. If you see that you are facing left, you should point straight ahead. When you turn your head away, and turn left, the direction is straight. If you see that you are facing right, put the left foot on the right foot. When you turn you should point the direction is straight. If you see that you are facing left, put the right foot on the left foot. When you turn, you should always point to the right-hand side. If you see that you are facing left, take the right foot on the right foot. When you are facing up, put the right foot on the left foot. When you are facing down, take the right foot on the right foot. When you see that you are facing up, put the right foot on the third foot as you are facing down. When you see that you are facing down, place the back foot on the left foot. When you see that you are about to stand, place the left shoe on top of the right foot.
